titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 976) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide tax relief for small businesses, and for other purposes.
Providing for the consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 976) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide tax relief for small businesses, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-346, by Mr. McGovern.
Providing for the consideration of the Senate amendments to H.R. 976.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 121.

action.text: Point of order raised by Mr. Rogers (MI) on the content of the measure. Mr. Rogers (MI) stated that the provisions of H. Res. 675 violate House earmark rules. Point of order overruled by the Chair.
Mr. Rogers (MI) appealed the ruling of the chair. The question was then put on sustaining the ruling of the chair.
Mr. McGovern moved to table the motion to appeal the ruling of the chair
On motion to table the motion to appeal the ruling of the chair Agreed to by recorded vote: 224 - 190 (Roll no. 902).
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 675.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218 - 197 (Roll no. 903).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 215 - 199, 2 Present (Roll no. 904).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Sets forth a rule for the consideration of H.R. 976 (Children's Health Insurance Program Reauthorization Act of 2007).
